intro: Stenorrhynchos hysteranthum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15-30 cm and prefers bright, indirect light. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including pink, purple, and white, and bloom throughout the year under proper care. Stenorrhynchos hysteranthum is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
